author: FE Online
title: BMC polls 2017: Here is the full list of winners, Shiv Sena bags 84 seats, Snehal Ambekar big winner; BJP gets 81 seats, Neil Somaiya puts up fine show
text:
India news BMC polls 2017: Here is the full list of winners, Shiv Sena bags 84 seats, Snehal Ambekar big winner; BJP gets 81 seats, Neil Somaiya puts up fine show BMC polls 2017: Here is the full list of winners, Shiv Sena bags 84 seats, Snehal Ambekar big winner; BJP gets 81 seats, Neil Somaiya puts up fine show Shiv Sena was declared the winner of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation Elections 2017 with 84, while its bitter allies, the Bhartiya Janata Party came mighty close with 81 seats of its own By: FE Online | Updated: February 23, 2017 5:52 PM There was a lot at stake for both Shiv Sena and the BJP, two saffron allies for over 20 years, who have been going through a fallout(PTI) 
Shiv Sena was declared the winner of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation Elections 2017 with 84, while its bitter allies, the Bhartiya Janata Party came mighty close with 81 seats of its own. There was a lot at stake for both Shiv Sena and the BJP , two saffron allies for over 20 years, who have been going through a fallout. Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray had openly criticised the BJP government in the state under Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Prime Minister Narendra Modi ’s demonetisation scheme. For the most part of the day, it looked as if the Shiv Sena would run away with an absolute majority for more time but BJP changed gears towards the end of the day and raced to 82 seats. Although, since none of the parties gained the required 114 seats to reach an absolute majority, the picture still remains unclear as to who will take over the reigns of the richest Municipal corporation in the world. 
In the weeks leading to the BMC polls, Shiv Sena had launched a series of attacks directed towards the Bhartiya Janata Party. Shiv Sena supremo Uddhav Thackeray had spoken against the demonetisation drive citing the problems faced by the common man. Later, after weeks of silence on the part of BJP, the party had released a cartoon video, calling Shiv Sena as the “Khau Sena” and criticised it for its corrupt activities. Earlier today, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari is happy with BJP’s performance and congratulated party workers. “For the first time, BJP has got such unprecedented success. I congratulate Maharashtra CM &BJP workers,” he had said. 
Here is the list of winners for Shiv Sena 
Tejasvini Ghosalkar
